name: ipc.maximum.data.length
description:
This indicates the maximum IPC message length (bytes) that can be
    accepted by the server. Messages larger than this value are rejected by the
    immediately to avoid possible OOMs. This setting should rarely need to be
    changed.

name: dfs.block.invalidate.limit
description:
The maximum number of invalidate blocks sent by namenode to a datanode
    per heartbeat deletion command. This property works with
    "dfs.namenode.invalidate.work.pct.per.iteration" to throttle block
    deletions.

name: mapreduce.input.lineinputformat.linespermap
description:
When using NLineInputFormat, the number of lines of input data
  to include in each split.

name: dfs.namenode.checkpoint.check.period
description:
The SecondaryNameNode and CheckpointNode will poll the NameNode
  every 'dfs.namenode.checkpoint.check.period' seconds to query the number
  of uncheckpointed transactions. Support multiple time unit suffix(case insensitive),
  as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval.If no time unit is specified then
  seconds is assumed.

name: ipc.client.connect.timeout
description:
Indicates the number of milliseconds a client will wait for the
               socket to establish a server connection.

name: net.topology.script.number.args
description:
The max number of args that the script configured with
    net.topology.script.file.name should be run with. Each arg is an
    IP address.

name: mapreduce.job.max.split.locations
description:
The max number of block locations to store for each split for
    locality calculation.

name: mapreduce.shuffle.connection-keep-alive.timeout
description:
The number of seconds a shuffle client attempts to retain
   http connection. Refer "Keep-Alive: timeout=" header in
   Http specification

name: dfs.datanode.network.counts.cache.max.size
description:
The maximum number of entries the datanode per-host network error
    count cache may contain.

name: dfs.namenode.replication.max-streams-hard-limit
description: Hard limit for all replication streams.
